documentation.text:
@notice Tracks total number of items sold by this contract, including those
purchased free of charge by the contract owner.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Monotonic.Increaser storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

documentation.text: @notice Returns the total number of items sold by this contract.

@notice Returns min(n, max(extra items addr can purchase)) and reverts if 0.
@param zeroMsg The message with which to revert on 0 extra.
@notice Emitted when a buyer is refunded.
@notice Emitted on all purchases of non-zero amount.
@notice Tracks number of items purchased free of charge.

documentation.text:
@notice Allows the contract owner to purchase without payment, within the
quota enforced by the SellerConfig.

@notice Convenience function for calling _purchase() with empty costMetadata
when unneeded.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Monotonic.Increaser storage pointer) view returns (uint256)
function (struct Monotonic.Increaser storage pointer) view returns (uint256)
function (struct Monotonic.Increaser storage pointer) view returns (uint256)
function (struct Monotonic.Increaser storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

Refund(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when a buyer is refunded.

Revenue(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted on all purchases of non-zero amount.

cost(uint256,uint256).details: Must return the current cost of a batch of items. This may be constant or, for example, decreasing for a Dutch auction or increasing for a bonding curve.

params.metadata: Arbitrary data, propagated by the call to _purchase() that can be used to charge different prices. This value is a uint256 instead of bytes as this allows simple passing of a set cost (see ArbitraryPriceSeller).
params.n: The number of items being purchased.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

purchaseFreeOfCharge(address,uint256).notice: Allows the contract owner to purchase without payment, within the quota enforced by the SellerConfig.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

totalSold().notice: Returns the total number of items sold by this contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

natspec.notice: An abstract contract providing the _purchase() function to: - Enforce per-wallet / per-transaction limits - Calculate required cost, forwarding to a beneficiary, and refunding extra

_bought.details: This isn't public as it may be skewed due to differences in msg.sender and tx.origin, which it treats in the same way such that sum(_bought)>=totalSold().
